title: 100 Espresso custom matchers
Espresso by default has many matchers that help you find views that you need to do some checks or interactions with them.

inline_content.Text: Espresso by default has many matchers that help you find views that you need to do some checks or interactions with them.

title: Most important ones can be found in the following cheat sheet:

inline_content.Text: Most important ones can be found in the following cheat sheet:

title: https://google.github.io/android-testing-support-library/docs/espresso/cheatsheet/
Some examples of matchers are:
withId(R.id.ID_of_object_you_are_looking_for);
withText(“Some text you expect object to have”);

inline_content.Text: withText(“Some text you expect object to have”);

title: isDisplayed() <– check is the view visible

inline_content.Text: isDisplayed() <– check is the view visible

title: doesNotExist() <– check that the view does not exist

inline_content.Text: doesNotExist() <– check that the view does not exist

title: All of these are very useful for everyday use, but if you have more complex views writing your custom matchers can make the tests more readable and you can reuse them in different places.

inline_content.Text: All of these are very useful for everyday use, but if you have more complex views writing your custom matchers can make the tests more readable and you can reuse them in different places.

title: There are 2 most common type of matchers you can extend:
TypeSafeMatcher
b
BoundedMatcher
b

inline_content.Text: There are 2 most common type of matchers you can extend:

title: Implementing TypeSafeMatcher requires you to check the instanceOf the view you are asserting against, if its the correct type you match some of its properties against a value you provided to a matcher.

inline_content.Text: Implementing TypeSafeMatcher requires you to check the instanceOf the view you are asserting against, if its the correct type you match some of its properties against a value you provided to a matcher.

title: For example, type safe matcher that validates an image view has correct drawable:
